Why Is Hyperliquid (HYPE) Up Today?  Hyperliquid $HYPE   is trading higher today, driven by strong buying interest and rising market participation. One of the main catalysts is the 25% jump in 24-hour trading volume, which signals increased demand and renewed confidence from traders. As volume expands alongside price, it often reflects momentum-driven accumulation rather than a short-lived spike.  Another factor supporting HYPE‚Äôs move is its fixed maximum supply, which removes dilution risk and can amplify upside during periods of demand. With only a portion of tokens currently circulating, investors may be pricing in future ecosystem growth and increased usage of the Hyperliquid platform.  Additionally, broader positive sentiment across altcoins has helped lift HYPE, as traders rotate into high-liquidity, high-growth projects. Hyperliquid is sitting on a single, massive concentration risk. One wallet controls over a third of total open interest with a gigantic multi-asset long that‚Äôs already deep in the red. The backstop meant to absorb failures is smaller than the losses this position would create if price slips a bit further.  If that unwind triggers, the system has only two options: spread the damage across every trader or dilute by creating new supply. Neither is neutral for holders. With $HYPE  priced where it is, the setup isn‚Äôt nuanced ‚Äî it‚Äôs a fork in the road where the outcome flips hard based on where price breaks first.
